page.title: 15A DAY AT St. BEDES SCHOOL
page.content:
I walk to the{FRENCHES ROAD ANNEXE} with a friend and we arrive at about 8-40 a.m. The Annexe is part of{St. {BEDES SCHOOL}and is used to house the Second Year. It is made up of two Victorian buildings with a playground between.
The first thing we do when we arrive at the school is give in our homework, then we walk around until the bell. After registration we have an assembly in the hall or in our classroom. The classroom assemblies are better because we do them ourselves.
There are eight lessons each day. Our classes are made up of thirty to thirty-five pupils. We do most of our work in class but each evening we have homework which takes about one and a half hours to complete.
